entry.key: About dissolve effects, what ways do i have? How to sync dissolving of sprite with physics blocks?
Are your colliders supposed to cover the entire sprite from edge to edge? - yes they supposed to

As you can see object visibility is dictated by light source collider2d. Main concern for now is to be sure that all works fine with physics. Like example: part of the wall is under light and player can pass through. Or floor is becomed lighted and disapear under player. It actually works in demo levels i build. I think you agree that it is not the worst way to implement that mechanic and we can easialy optimize this in future. But maybe there some other significatly better alternatives?

I mean blocks of provided data from @<file_name>

I mostly like approach with shader, but i dont know how to sync it with physics. Like i have: wall sprite, 10 physics blocks of it. 2 of them disable physics - how to pass this data to shader of wall sprite?
Is it needed for it to be 300 lines of code, or could be simplified?
It is too slow, and dont look smooth. I can easialy see "blocks" that shouldnt be the case
It looks like bad practice to test animations. We should focus on pure logic i think - event fires, shader receivec correct data
Lets go with Option B. PlayTests looks like poverfull way of integration test

Okay i try to descibe my setup: I have spriterenderer object and box collider objects under parent sync. spriterenderer localy located at Vector.Zero and has (3.165118, 1.002306, 1) scale. collider has custom position, scale, and collider offset. After auto-settuping they appear to be more righter then should be
Problem was that there was one extra one) Is it now looks correct? I mean covers all space of sprite?
Problem with this dissolve shader, that it separate sprite on areas and treat it as chuncks. Instead it should add disolve effect, so it smoothly blends to not disolved parts.
